data.question: What is the main challenge in energetic materials chemistry?
data.answer: Producing a material that will release large amounts of energy when desired but still be safe enough to handle without energetic decomposition.

data.question: What are the two major strategies for incorporating energetic properties into a molecule?
data.answer: The first strategy is fuel and oxidizer in the same molecule, and the second broad category is high heat of formation compounds.

data.question: Why are nitrogen-rich compounds considered for energetic materials?
data.answer: Nitrogen-rich compounds offer unique chemical properties that can allow stabilization via several distinct methods.

data.question: What is the APNC theory?
data.answer: The APNC (alternating positive negative charge) theory suggests that stable nitrogen-rich systems can have one of their resonance forms illustrated with positive and negative charges on alternating atoms.

data.question: What is the significance of the 1,3-bis(nitroimido)-1,2,3-triazolate anion in the design of energetic materials?
data.answer: The 1,3-bis(nitroimido)-1,2,3-triazolate anion is found to be very high performing with high thermal stabilities while being quite sensitive to mechanical stimuli, providing unique insight into high-nitrogen systems.

data.question: Is the synthesis of octanitrocubane practical for use in energetic materials?
data.answer: False

data.question: Do the APNC systems contribute to the thermal stability of energetic materials?
data.answer: True

data.question: Can the resonance forms of the 1,3-bis(nitroimido)-1,2,3-triazolate anion be illustrated with alternating positive and negative charges?
data.answer: True

data.question: Are all materials prepared in the study insensitive to various stimuli?
data.answer: False

data.question: Does the study conclude that alternating positive and negative charges in a system can contribute to high thermal stability but not necessarily to reduced mechanical sensitivities?
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the impact sensitivity classification for materials with an impact sensitivity greater than 40 J according to the UN recommendations?
data.answer: Insensitive

data.question: What computational method was used to calculate the heats of formation of the investigated compounds?
data.answer: The CBS-4 M method was used to calculate the heats of formation.

data.question: What is the role of the nitroimide functionality in the design of energetic materials?
data.answer: The nitroimide functionality allows for the creation of extended APNC (alternating positive negative charge) systems, contributing to the stability of energetic materials.

data.question: Are energetic materials based on the 1,3-bis(nitroimido)-1,2,3-triazolate anion highly sensitive?
data.answer: True

data.question: What experimental techniques were used to characterize the prepared materials based on the 1,3-bis(nitroimido)-1,2,3-triazolate anion?
data.answer: The materials were characterized chemically (infrared, Raman, NMR, X-ray) and as high explosives in terms of their energetic performances and sensitivities.

data.question: Does the study provide a detailed synthesis for the 1,3-bis(nitroimido)-1,2,3-triazolate anion?
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the impact of the oxygen balance on the sensitivity of energetic molecules?
data.answer: As the oxygen balance improves, indicating a better ratio of fuels to oxidizers, the sensitivities toward impact have been shown to increase.

data.question: What is the significance of the resonance forms in the stability of nitrogen-rich systems?
data.answer: The resonance forms, particularly those illustrating alternating positive and negative charges, contribute to the stability of nitrogen-rich systems by adequately separating σ- and π-systems.

data.question: Are the mechanical sensitivities of energetic materials based on the 1,3-bis(nitroimido)-1,2,3-triazolate anion too high for practical use?
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the role of computational calculations in the study of the 1,3-bis(nitroimido)-1,2,3-triazolate anion?
data.answer: Computational calculations were used to predict energetic performance properties and confirm the high energetic properties of this class of materials.
